result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse R. Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Buffalo County Case No. 2016CM150

timeConds.notes:
Serve 15 days in the Pepin County Jail with huber privileges.
AMENDED 04-03-2017 at request of Pepin County Jail.  Jail sentence to commence on the same date as his Buffalo County sentence.
Concurrent with: Buffalo County Case No. 2016CM150.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse R. Bauer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jesse R. Bauer in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of disorderly conduct/max penalties, defendant enters plea of no contest; court advises defendant of OAR/OWI related, defendant enters plea of no contest.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant.  Defendant is citizen of US; agrees facts support the charge.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty.  On OAR charge assess fine including costs of $516.00 to be paid in installments of $50/mo. com. 5/1; complete TTP form; on Disorderly Conduct charges withhold sentence and place defendant on 1 yr. probation; condition: 15 days in the PCJ concurrent with Buffalo County Case No. 16CM150; waive costs; provide DNA sample, stop by the jail.
Plea hearing on March 20, 2017 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Jesse R. Bauer in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires of defendant's address.  806 W. Main St, Mondovi.  Court informs defendant to keep the court informed of any change of address.  Defendant previously plead in Buffalo Co. to DC, OAR, Paraphernalia charges with probation, 10 days jail, fine.  State's thoughts on these cases is defendant will plead to OAR in 16CT30 with 1 yr. probation concurrent to Buffalo Co.; plead to DC in 16CM27 with 14 days PCJ concurrent with Buffalo Co.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

Court advises defendant he has the same rights as other case.  NGP entered.  Atty Falch informs they will not be able to represent defendant on OAR as he now has a job.
